abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Strategic Roads
            Infrastructure Project for the Republic of Indonesia were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was substantial, bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory and borrower performance was
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: lack
            of sufficient readiness on the part of the Government
            immediately after the loan signing results in significant
            implementation delays, restrictions in the Governments
            budget cycle, such as the need to re-budget for delayed
            activities at the beginning of the new fiscal year, lead to
            disbursement lags and delayed payments to contractors and
            consultants, the effectiveness of road safety measures are
            jeopardized when road safety audits (RSA) are only conducted
            during implementation and anti-corruption measures that lack
            alignment with broader Government priorities and systems are
            difficult to implement.
